p: d-limonene ((4 R)-1-methyl-4-isopropenylcyclohex-1-ene) ( Figure 6) is one of natureâ€™s most common terpenes, an important constituent in various citrus oils (orange, lemon, mandarin, lime and grapefruit). It can decrease oxidative stress and inflammation [ 73], has potentially beneficial effects on colon cancer [ 74], antibacterial activity [ 75], and neuroprotective properties [ 76] described in the literature.
